column6: A section title should start with a capital letter.

column5: A section title should not end with a punctuation symbol.
A section title should not be written in all caps. The LaTeX stylesheet takes care of rendering titles in caps if needed.

column8: A figure caption should end with a period.

column9: Add a space before citation or reference.

column5: Remove space between citation/reference and punctuation.

column6: Do not use 'in [X]': the syntax of a sentence should not be changed by the removal of a citation.

column9: Use a capital letter when referring to a specific figure: 'Figure X'
Use a capital letter when referring to a specific section: 'Section X'
Use a capital letter when referring to a specific chapter: 'Chapter X'
Use a capital letter when referring to a specific table: 'Table X'
Do not refer to figures using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.

column8: Do not refer to sections using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.
Do not refer to chapters using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.

column9: Do not refer to tables using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.
